review_blob: This German sounding lager was sold in brown bottles and proudly proclaimed that it met the German Reinheitsgebot 1516 Purity Law. It now has a different label, is in a green bottle, the small print states it is brewed in France (despite the German sounding name) and the reference to Reinheitsgebot has vanished. Im surprised that as a German company Lidl cannot supply us with decent beer from some of the countries many fine breweries. These comments relate to a bottle purchased at the Maidenhead England store on 6 May 2014
